If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/
-->


**What happened**:
Working on a generalization of the max-in-flight filter, I noticed it is positioned inconsistently in the secure vs insecure handler chains.
At https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/a1f1f0b599e961a5c59b02c349c0ed818b1851a5/staging/src/k8s.io/apiserver/pkg/server/config.go#L589 I see it is very late in the secure handler chain, just before authorization.
At https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/a1f1f0b599e961a5c59b02c349c0ed818b1851a5/pkg/kubeapiserver/server/insecure_handler.go#L34 I see it comes much earlier, preceding audit, authentication, and timeout (unlike the secured chain).

NB: by "early" and "late" here I refer to the order in which the filters run, which is the opposite of the order in which they are constructed.

**What you expected to happen**:
I expected the two handler chains to put the filters they have in common in the same order.
